intro: Aquilegia leptoceras var. lutea, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring palmately divided leaves and a taproot system. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, often found in woodland edges and meadows. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
